SEARCH
Package examblock.model

Class Session

Object
Session
All Implemented Interfaces:
ManageableListItem, StreamManager
public class Session extends Object implements StreamManager, ManageableListItem
An object describing a single Exam Session. An exam "session" is a block of time in a particular Venue, with zero or more Exams. Sessions are numbered from 1 and unique in each venue, but not across venues. Session number can be, but do not have to be, in chronological order of session start times. That is, a new session may be inserted earlier into an existing schedule. Session numbers do not have to necessarily be sequential.

  • Constructor Details

    • Session

      public Session(Venue venue, int sessionNumber, LocalDate day, LocalTime start, Registry registry)
      Constructs a new empty Exam Session for a particular Venue. The calling process must check that the supplied session number is unique for this venue. Session numbers do not have to be sequential, only unique. The constructor must also prepare the empty (unassigned as yet) desks that will be used in this session. (The session has the same rows and columns of desks as the venue.)
      Parameters:
      venue - the exam venue for the new session.
      sessionNumber - the number (unique by venue) of the new session.
      day - the session date.
      start - the start time of the exam window
      registry - the global subject registry, needed to resolve textual Subject names

    • Session

      public Session(BufferedReader br, Registry registry, int nthItem) throws IOException, RuntimeException
      Constructs a Session by reading a description from a text stream
      Parameters:
      br - BufferedReader opened and ready to read from
      registry - the global registry, where we query and register new list objects
      nthItem - the index number of this serialized object
      Throws:
      IOException - on any read failure
      RuntimeException

  • Method Details

    • streamOut

      public void streamOut(BufferedWriter bw, int nthItem) throws IOException
      Used to write data to the disk.

      The format of the text written to the stream must be matched exactly by streamIn, so it is very important to format the output as described.

      1. Venue: V1+V2+V3, Session Number: 1, Day: 2025-03-10, Start: 12:30, Student Count: 53, Exams: 2
      Year 12 Internal Assessment Literature
      [Desks: 36]
      Desk: 1, LUI: 9999831170, Name: Ahmad, Tariq N.
      Desk: 2, LUI: 9999353258, Name: Black, Eliza G.
      Desk: 3, LUI: 9999257005, Name: Carpenter, Noah E.
      ...
      Desk: 36, LUI: 9999332370, Name: Zhang, Mei S.
      Year 12 Internal Assessment Essential English
      [Desks: 17]
      Desk: 64, LUI: 9999440022, Name: Brown, Noah J.
      ...
      Desk: 79, LUI: 9999313004, Name: Williams, Jack T.
      Desk: 80, LUI: 9999131191, Name: Williams, Isla
      2. Venue: W1+W2, Session Number: 1, Day: 2025-03-10, Start: 12:30, Student Count: 7, Exams: 2
      Year 12 Internal Assessment Literature
      [Desks: 6]
      Desk: 1, LUI: 9999493906, Name: Black, Mitchell C.
      ...
      Desk: 6, LUI: 9999865763, Name: Wang, Chen A.
      Year 12 Internal Assessment Essential English
      [Desks: 1]
      Desk: 15, LUI: 9999406335, Name: Howard, Felix A.
      Specified by:
      streamOut in interface StreamManager
      Parameters:
      bw - writer, already opened. Your data should be written at the current file position
      nthItem - a number representing this item's position in the stream. Used for sanity checks
      Throws:
      IOException - on any stream related issues

    • streamIn

      public void streamIn(BufferedReader br, Registry registry, int nthItem) throws IOException, RuntimeException
      Used to read data from the disk. IOExceptions and RuntimeExceptions must be allowed to propagate out to the calling method, which co-ordinates the streaming. Any other exceptions should be converted to RuntimeExceptions and rethrown.

      For the format of the text in the input stream, refer to the streamOut documentation.
      Specified by:
      streamIn in interface StreamManager
      Parameters:
      br - reader, already opened.
      registry - the global object registry
      nthItem - a number representing this item's position in the stream. Used for sanity checks
      Throws:
      IOException - on any stream related issues
      RuntimeException - on any logic related issues

    • countStudents

      public int countStudents()
      Counts the number of student-exam pairs where the student's AARA status matches the venue's AARA status and the student is enrolled in the subject of an exam. A student may be counted multiple times if they match multiple exams or subjects.
      Returns:
      the total count of matching student-exam pairs

    • allocateStudents

      public void allocateStudents(ExamList exams, StudentList cohort)

      Parameters:
      exams - the current set of Year 12 Exams.
      cohort - all the Year 12 students.

    • printDesks

      public void printDesks()
      Prints the layout of the desks in this session in the venue. Prints a grid of the deskNumber, family name, and given name and initial for each desk.

    • printDesks

      public void printDesks(StringBuilder sb)
      Appends the desk allocation to the provided StringBuilder. Replaces PrintWriter output for Assignment 2.
      Parameters:
      sb - the StringBuilder to append to
